PhilJS vs Leptos

PhilJS and Leptos are both Rust-first web frameworks with fine-grained reactivity. PhilJS adds first-class TypeScript support for mixed-language or TS-only projects.

i

Shared Philosophy

Both frameworks embrace Rust's type safety and performance while providing reactive primitives similar to SolidJS. The main difference is PhilJS's dual TypeScript/Rust support.

Language Support

AspectLeptosPhilJS
Primary LanguageRust onlyTypeScript + Rust
Frontend OptionsRust/WASMTS, Rust/WASM, or hybrid
Backend OptionsRust (Actix/Axum)Node.js, Rust, or hybrid
Shared TypesRust structsTS interfaces or Rust structs

Syntax Comparison

Component Definition

Leptos

use leptos::*;
 
#[component]
fn Counter(initial: i32) -> impl IntoView {
    let (count, set_count) = create_signal(initial);
 
    view! {
        <button on:click=move |_| {
            set_count.update(|n| *n += 1)
        }>
            "Count: " {count}
        </button>
    }
}

PhilJS (Rust)

use philjs::prelude::*;
 
#[component]
fn Counter(initial: i32) -> impl IntoView {
    let (count, set_count) = create_signal(initial);
 
    view! {
        <button on:click=move |_| {
            set_count.update(|n| *n += 1)
        }>
            "Count: " {count}
        </button>
    }
}

The Rust syntax is nearly identical! PhilJS also supports TypeScript:

1// PhilJS (TypeScript)
2import { createSignal } from 'philjs-core';
3 
4function Counter({ initial = 0 }: { initial?: number }) {
5  const [count, setCount] = createSignal(initial);
6 
7  return (
8    <button onClick={() => setCount(n => n + 1)}>
9      Count: {count()}
10    </button>
11  );
12}

Server Functions

Leptos

#[server(GetTodos, "/api")]
pub async fn get_todos() -> Result<Vec<Todo>, ServerFnError> {
    let pool = expect_context::<SqlitePool>();
    let todos = sqlx::query_as!(Todo,
        "SELECT * FROM todos"
    )
    .fetch_all(&pool)
    .await?;
    Ok(todos)
}

PhilJS (Rust)

#[server(GetTodos)]
pub async fn get_todos() -> Result<Vec<Todo>, ServerFnError> {
    let pool = expect_context::<SqlitePool>();
    let todos = sqlx::query_as!(Todo,
        "SELECT * FROM todos"
    )
    .fetch_all(&pool)
    .await?;
    Ok(todos)
}

Key Differences

TypeScript Interoperability

1// PhilJS allows mixing TS and Rust in the same project
2// shared/types.ts - Generated from Rust or written in TS
3export interface Todo {
4  id: number;
5  title: string;
6  completed: boolean;
7}
8 
9// frontend/components/TodoList.tsx - TypeScript component
10import { createSignal, For } from 'philjs-core';
11import type { Todo } from '../shared/types';
12 
13function TodoList({ todos }: { todos: Todo[] }) {
14  return (
15    <For each={todos}>
16      {(todo) => <TodoItem todo={todo} />}
17    </For>
18  );
19}
20 
21// Use Rust for performance-critical parts
22// backend/processing.rs - Rust processing
23#[wasm_bindgen]
24pub fn process_todos(todos: JsValue) -> JsValue {
25    let todos: Vec<Todo> = serde_wasm_bindgen::from_value(todos).unwrap();
26    // Heavy processing in Rust
27    serde_wasm_bindgen::to_value(&processed).unwrap()
28}

Hydration Strategies

Leptos

// Leptos - Component-level islands
#[island]
fn InteractiveCounter() -> impl IntoView {
    // This component hydrates independently
    let (count, set_count) = create_signal(0);
    view! { <button>{count}</button> }
}
 
// Usage
view! {
    <InteractiveCounter />
}

PhilJS

// PhilJS - Flexible island directives
// In Rust
view! {
    <Island client:visible>
        <Counter />
    </Island>
}
 
// In TypeScript
<Island client:idle priority="low">
  <HeavyChart />
</Island>
 
<Island client:media="(min-width: 768px)">
  <DesktopNav />
</Island>

Tooling

ToolLeptosPhilJS
Dev Servercargo-leptoscargo-philjs + Vite
Hot ReloadWASM hot reloadTS hot reload + WASM hot reload
Buildcargo buildpnpm build / cargo build
Formattingleptosfmtrustfmt + Prettier
Type GenerationN/ARust to TS types

Router Comparison

Leptos

use leptos_router::*;
 
view! {
    <Router>
        <Routes>
            <Route path="/" view=HomePage/>
            <Route path="/users/:id" view=UserPage/>
            <Route path="/*any" view=NotFound/>
        </Routes>
    </Router>
}
 
// Access params
#[component]
fn UserPage() -> impl IntoView {
    let params = use_params_map();
    let id = move || params.with(|p| p.get("id").cloned());
    view! { <p>"User: " {id}</p> }
}

PhilJS

use philjs_router::*;
 
view! {
    <Router>
        <Routes>
            <Route path="/" view=HomePage/>
            <Route path="/users/:id" view=UserPage/>
            <Route path="/*" view=NotFound/>
        </Routes>
    </Router>
}
 
// Similar param access
#[component]
fn UserPage() -> impl IntoView {
    let params = use_params::<UserParams>();
    view! { <p>"User: " {move || params().id}</p> }
}
 
// Or in TypeScript
const { id } = useParams<{ id: string }>();

Performance Comparison

Both frameworks compile to efficient WASM with similar runtime performance. Key differences:

  • Bundle size: Similar for pure Rust; PhilJS TypeScript builds are smaller
  • Initial load: PhilJS TS hydrates faster than WASM
  • Runtime: Both achieve near-native performance in WASM
  • Hybrid: PhilJS allows TS for UI, Rust for compute-heavy parts

Ecosystem

FeatureLeptosPhilJS
UI ComponentsCommunity cratesphiljs-ui (TS + Rust)
FormsBuilt-inphiljs-forms
StylingStylers cratephiljs-css / Tailwind
TestingRust testsRust + TS tests
DevToolsBrowser WASM debuggerphiljs-devtools extension

When to Choose Which

Choose Leptos if:

  • You want pure Rust throughout your stack
  • Your team is all Rust developers
  • You don't need TypeScript interoperability
  • You prefer a more established Rust-only ecosystem

Choose PhilJS if:

  • You want to mix TypeScript and Rust
  • You have developers with different language backgrounds
  • You want to progressively adopt Rust
  • You need npm ecosystem access
  • You want faster TypeScript hot reload during development

Migration Path

Migrating between Leptos and PhilJS Rust code is relatively straightforward due to similar APIs:

1// Leptos -> PhilJS: Main changes
2use philjs::prelude::*;       // was: use leptos::*;
3use philjs_router::*;          // was: use leptos_router::*;
4 
5// Most component code is identical
6#[component]
7fn App() -> impl IntoView {
8    // Same signal API
9    let (count, set_count) = create_signal(0);
10 
11    // Same view! macro
12    view! {
13        <button on:click=move |_| set_count.update(|n| *n += 1)>
14            {count}
15        </button>
16    }
17}
